author: , The Topeka Capital-Journal
title: Washburn Tech to open manufacturing institute at former Kmart in North Topeka
text:
Washburn Tech to open manufacturing institute at former Kmart in North Topeka
Washburn Institute of Technology is opening a manufacturing institute in North Topeka.
On Thursday afternoon, the Washburn University Board of Regents unanimously approved the purchase of the former Kmart building at 2240 N.W. Tyler St. The purchase price was $2 million.
“Through utilization of an existing structure, Washburn Tech has the ability to refurbish a large portion of the building while still preserving room to grow in the future and continue to respond to the state’s workforce needs,” said Scott Smathers, Washburn Tech dean, in a written statement. “We believe this is the best option for investing state and donor dollars, as well as the best way to serve students and prepare them for careers that are high-pay and high-demand.”
Bringing a manufacturing program to Topeka
Washburn Tech is expanding now because of a growing manufacturing industry in Kansas.
“Washburn Tech is committed to our local manufacturing partners and their growing need for a highly skilled workforce,” said Washburn president JuliAnn Mazachek, in a written statement. “Our new Manufacturing Institute will allow us to expand existing programs, launch new pathways, repurpose a vacant structure and strengthen our connection to the northern part of the community.”
How the former Kmart facility will be used
All of the Topeka locations for Kmart closed due to liquidation. The
[North Topeka location](https://www.cjonline.com/story/news/local/2016/01/12/kmart-north-topeka-close-liquidation-sale-begins-jan-24/16604575007/) closed in 2016.
Mazachek said Washburn Tech intends to save costs by using some pre-existing features of the 90,000-square-foot property.
“North Topeka is a thriving sector of our community and conveniently located for many of our adult students as well as students from more than 40 Northeast Kansas high schools,” Mazachek said. “The Manufacturing Institute in North Topeka is an exciting next step in providing the best academic experience for our students while continuing to strengthen the pipeline of workers required to fuel our economy.”
Planning and construction will begin in early 2025.
The existing Washburn Tech facilities at 5724 S.W. Huntoon Ave. and 2014 S.E. Washington St. will continue to operate.
(This story was updated to add new information.)

author: Rebecaa
title: Re: Issue with Google nest hub
text:
Monday
I am having an issue with my speaker I ask it to play a specific radio station and it won’t play it started about a week ago
the specific radio station I want it to play is “105.1 knci” which is a local country radio station and it jut won’t work I have already tried re setting the devices and still not working it also did this wit other radio stations. is their a way to fix this because I mainly use it to listen to to the radio I hate to have to look in to getting some other devices
, it starts to load, fails, and shows a generic audacy icon.
any one have some sort of of solution to this
Monday
I have the same issue. Very frustrating
Monday
I have the same problem with 3aw and 6pr radio. But plays other stations. Since Friday this has been the problem
Monday
Radioapp doesn't play any station. Started about 4 days ago. Works on my other google devices just not my nest hub.
yesterday
I have the same problem and it is very annoying. It was even mentioned on 2GB this morning. I have contacted Google as 2GB stated they will follow up and as well, I also emailed the RadioApp people direct ( it's Australian ), to no avail. as of this stage. Resetting the Google Nest device of storage & cache does not clear the problem.
I would point out I have no trouble streaming Radio with Amazon Alexa devices at this point.
yesterday
I resetted all my google nests and none work on 3aw 2gb 6pr.seems to be the only stations that don’t work on mine. I listen to sen Melbourne and Perth sen and no problems.
thanks for your info and I hope they can fix it.
54m ago
Hello to all on this thread.
This turns out to be most likely a worldwide Google firmware issue.
Lots of info and discussion on workarounds and fixes that appear to being rolled out in the UK.
https://www.googlenestcommunity.com/t5/Speakers-and-Displays/RadioApp-no-loading-on-Google-Nest-Hub-...

author: Karla Baylon
title: Mexicalenses utilizan 30% más de agua durante el verano
text:
Mexicalenses utilizan 30% más de agua durante el verano
Se prevé un incremento del consumo de agua de entre el 20% y 30% una vez que inicie el verano en Mexicali
Mexicali, Baja California.- Se prevé un incremento del consumo de agua de entre el 20% y 30% una vez que inicie el verano en Mexicali, informó el director de la Comisión Estatal de Servicios Públicos de Mexicali (CESPM), Armando Carrazo López.
‘’Se incrementa alrededor de un entre el 20 y 30% es muy fluctuante’’, añadió.
El incremento en el consumo de agua se manifiesta principalmente durante ciertos lapsos de la tarde, principalmente entre las 11 de la mañana y las 4 de la tarde.
Con un estándar estimado de 191 litros por habitante por día, Mexicali es uno de los municipios de Baja California donde más agua se consume, con 278 litros diarios por habitante por día.
El inicio de la primavera está programado para el próximo 20 marzo, la cual finaliza el 20 de junio, fecha en que inicia la temporada de verano, que es cuando las temperaturas ascienden hasta los 50 grados.
Actualmente en Mexicali existe un registro de que alrededor de entre el 2% y 5% de agua se desperdicia, ya sea porque se evapora o se trasmina, expuso el funcionario.
98% de cobertura de agua potable
En otro dato, resaltó que la cobertura de agua potable en Mexicali es del 98%, por lo que para este año se contempla alcanzar el 100%, sin embargo, subrayó que no pueden dejar de lado los trabajos de reposición de tubería.
‘’Tenemos tuberías que ya tienen 60 años como esta fuga histórica que acabamos de reparar en el FEX que llevaba más de este 15 años que no se había intervenido y era una fuga controlada’’
El presupuesto de la CESPM para operar este año es de alrededor de 300 millones de pesos.

author: Farah Hannoun
title: Aljamain Sterling: Merab Dvalishvili 'is going to shut a lot of people up' vs. Umar Nurmagomedov at UFC 311
text:
Aljamain Sterling: Merab Dvalishvili ‘is going to shut a lot of people up’ vs. Umar Nurmagomedov at UFC 311
January 16, 2025 3:30 pm ET Aljamain Sterling thinks the odds are in Merab Dvalishvili’s favor to beat Umar Nurmagomedov at UFC 311. Dvalishvili (18-4 MMA, 11-2 UFC) defends his bantamweight title against Nurmagomedov (18-0 MMA, 6-0 UFC) in Saturday’s co-main event (pay-per-view, ESPNews/Disney+, ESPN+) at Intuit Dome in Inglewood, Calif. Although betting odds suggest otherwise, Sterling is confident that his teammate will remind everyone why he’s unbeaten in his past 11 appearances. “I think if we can keep the fight where we want it, Merab is going to shut a lot of people up and going to prove a…
Read more at MMA Junkie
